Subjective: Right eye red and irritated since Tuesday; feels like hair or dust in eye; no vision problems, no light sensitivity, no pain unless squeezing eyes shut; no fever or flu symptoms; no recent eye trauma; no contact lens use; never had eye issues before; has young daughter at home; managing well despite eye irritation; requesting eye check and treatment options
Objective: Right eye: redness, visible veins, no foreign body or abnormalities noted; left eye: mild redness starting, no foreign body or abnormalities noted; pupils reactive to light
Assessment: Viral conjunctivitis right eye, likely spreading to left eye; no signs of bacterial infection or vision-threatening issues
Plan: Use artificial tears as needed for comfort
Clean eyes with lukewarm tap water and cotton pad in the morning if sticky
Follow up in 2 weeks if not resolved; sooner if increased pain, pus, or vision changes
